messages: f7f5ab7651d32ce260d7ba5082d6cf83 (02:00): my point is this is pretty huge

a4687444fb35a0a63d65953dd342dfc4 (02:00): ZoFreX, firewalls do it by denying everything by default and allowing traffic if it matches a list of allowed patterns. Not by allowing everything and blocking only if it matches a disallowed pattern.
5620cee699332b301d1776328809ef32 (02:00): basically everyone thinks hacking is cool, so if they targeted that problem..
f7f5ab7651d32ce260d7ba5082d6cf83 (02:00): the first part of the winxp cert book should say 'no admin accounts retards only use normal user'
5620cee699332b301d1776328809ef32 (02:00): Xbit-MTX - yes, but I want to block everything by default and only allow by pattern
f7f5ab7651d32ce260d7ba5082d6cf83 (02:00): but they are hacking using their admin account leaving themselvs open hehehe
5620cee699332b301d1776328809ef32 (02:01): I use the admin account all the time... and to be honest, I've never had a problem. Not had a virus since Windos 98.
a4687444fb35a0a63d65953dd342dfc4 (02:01): ZoFreX, then your tool for that is called "limited user account".
5620cee699332b301d1776328809ef32 (02:01): limited users can still run any exe they want to
f7f5ab7651d32ce260d7ba5082d6cf83 (02:01): actually they arent really called limited user acocunt
f7f5ab7651d32ce260d7ba5082d6cf83 (02:01): its just  'user'
8d5b843f8613182cd679d2e5e504d0e3 (02:01): "Not had a virus since Windos 98."
f7f5ab7651d32ce260d7ba5082d6cf83 (02:01): ohhh but im on a domain
8d5b843f8613182cd679d2e5e504d0e3 (02:02): so ignorant.. how would you know if you had viruses anyways?
f7f5ab7651d32ce260d7ba5082d6cf83 (02:02): back in the days of 98  norton actually worked
a4687444fb35a0a63d65953dd342dfc4 (02:02): Doesn't matter. A virus exe can only mess up the profile at worst. And, you can deny the ability to execute programs inside the profile if you want.
a4687444fb35a0a63d65953dd342dfc4 (02:02): kaffien, yes I know its group is called "Users", but that's not what it's called by most people. :)
5620cee699332b301d1776328809ef32 (02:02): endra - I check fairly often. And I would notice increased cpu usage, extra programs, extra startup entries, etc etc
8d5b843f8613182cd679d2e5e504d0e3 (02:02): ZoFreX: viruses use rootkits as well

4925a8ebbce775bb295d67bee474cd95 (02:02): Is there a way to disable windows from telling me three times (yes, three times), that I have new hardware. I have an uninstalled printer hooked up, and I'm not going to install it, but I want to disable that anoying "Found new hardware" message

a4687444fb35a0a63d65953dd342dfc4 (02:09): It's possible to get a virus, but it's easy to clear it out with a limited account. Just delete the profile.
dc1a0f12f1b4160a8a2f56b8a66da64c (02:09): CoJaBo, they do in my district as well
5620cee699332b301d1776328809ef32 (02:09): they're so simple and so effective :( her one was a "lazarus worm"
f7f5ab7651d32ce260d7ba5082d6cf83 (02:09): limited accounts is just part of the equation
a4687444fb35a0a63d65953dd342dfc4 (02:09): Of course, if the filesystem is FAT rather than NTFS, then the security is kind of ineffective.
f7f5ab7651d32ce260d7ba5082d6cf83 (02:09): you shoudl have AV  + firewall  + common sense too

5620cee699332b301d1776328809ef32 (02:10): I used the very specific removal tool for that exact virus from Symantec
a4687444fb35a0a63d65953dd342dfc4 (02:10): kaffien: I think with limited accounts it's often permissible to have border security rather than having AV+firewall on every computer.
